page.title: 14GAMES CHILDREN PLAY
page.content:
QUEENIE EYE is a game played by three or more children. One child throws the ball over his shoulder to be caught by one of the others and hidden about their person. The thrower turns to the others and is asked, "Queenie Eye,Queenie Eye, who's got the ball?" If a correct guess is not made by the thrower straight away the others are asked to come forward one by one to be questioned. Elaborate ploys are used to deceive the thrower. If a correct guess is made then the child with the ball becomes the thrower and the game continues.
STUCK-IN-MUD is played by younger pupils and is like TIG. One child tries to catch others. If caught they are "stuck-in-mud" with outstretched arms. To be freed someone else has to run under their arms.
